Articles.Content:
Found a conflict with kopernicus. Here are the logs from a fresh install with only OPM and SVE plus their dependencies and AVC. All the latest versions. No errors with the default E.V.E configs (BoulderCo).

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/3w1thtr1iv062qq/AADHdrz7pxCTRq2ZmY4y-sr-a?dl=0

Edited April 11, 2018 by Errol

36 minutes ago, Errol said:

Found a conflict with kopernicus. Here are the logs from a fresh install with only OPM and SVE plus their dependencies and AVC. All the latest versions. No errors with the default E.V.E configs (BoulderCo).

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/3w1thtr1iv062qq/AADHdrz7pxCTRq2ZmY4y-sr-a?dl=0

What’s the issue, though? What am I looking for?

@Galileo I get a dialogue at the main menu warning me that there was an issue with loading the kopernicus planet pack, and to contact the mod authors. It also warns not to attempt loading a save. Trying to load into a game, it gets stuck on the loading screen and I never get into KSC.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/mfhzxf7n1es7fgm/Screenshot 2018-04-11 12.54.04.png?dl=0

Edited April 11, 2018 by Errol

Just now, Errol said:

I get a dialogue at the main menu warning me that there was an issue with loading the kopernicus planet pack, and to contact the mod authors. It also warns not to attempt loading a save. The one time I did bother trying to load into a game it ended up getting stuck on the loading screen and I never got into KSC.

Reinstall everything. Fresh. I run the latest stuff everyday, and developed everything with the latest OPM installed. I have seen people running the latest versions without issue as well and the fact that nobody else has reported this issue tells me it’s probably not on my end considering how many people use SVE and OPM. Ensure you have the latest everything for the version of ksp you run.
I just downloaded everything fresh today. This is not a kopernicus or EVE issue, as they work fine with the BoulderCo configs.

1 minute ago, Errol said:

I just downloaded everything fresh today. This is not a kopernicus or EVE issue, as they work fine with the BoulderCo configs.

I assume you didn’t download the latest sve textures. Kopernicus is looking for a texture you don’t have.

Edited April 11, 2018 by Galileo
I am using the low res textures.

Just now, Errol said:

I am using the low res textures.

Yes, the latest ones?

Yes, from here:

https://github.com/Galileo88/StockVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/1.0.7

2 minutes ago, Errol said:

Yes, from here:

https://github.com/Galileo88/StockVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/1.0.7

Try the medium res and see if the issue persists

Wow....I don't know what happened but I just tried re-downloading the low res texture pack, just to make sure, and it appears to work now. Perhaps the initial textures I downloaded got corrupted somehow (I live off the grid, and loose power when it is cloudy sometimes, like in the middle of typing this post for example). 

EDIT: I notice kerbin has taken on a noticeable blueish hue that was not there in previous versions, is this intended?

https://www.dropbox.com/s/4d8uqgnkv2rdh19/Screenshot 2018-04-11 13.26.23.png?dl=0

Edited April 11, 2018 by Errol

5 minutes ago, Errol said:

Wow....I don't know what happened but I just tried re-downloading the low res texture pack, just to make sure, and it appears to work now. Perhaps the initial textures I downloaded got corrupted somehow (I live off the grid, and loose power when it is cloudy sometimes).

Cool

1 minute ago, Galileo said:

Cool

(I added a screenshot and question to my post above)
Hi! Pls, help me. )) Witch last version SVE and SVT can i installed for KSP 1.3.1?
Does this work with OPM?

7 hours ago, The-Doctor said:

Does this work with OPM? 

Did you actually try reading the first post in the thread? It answers your question quite clearly:

"Added clouds and scatterer support for OPM"

On 12/04/2018 at 12:18 AM, nickicool said:

Hi! Pls, help me. )) Witch last version SVE and SVT can i installed for KSP 1.3.1?

It looks like the last version of SVE to support 1.3.1 was v1.2.9.0, presumably with version 1.0.4 textures.

For SVT, it looks like it was version 2.1.3.

You'll also have to make sure you've got the correct versions of EVE (for SVE) and Kopernicus (for SVT).

7 hours ago, UnanimousCoward said:

It looks like the last version of SVE to support 1.3.1 was v1.2.9.0, presumably with version 1.0.4 textures.

For SVT, it looks like it was version 2.1.3.

You'll also have to make sure you've got the correct versions of EVE (for SVE) and Kopernicus (for SVT).

Thank you very much!!

@GalileoNow I got this, I think it's the reason for my other post at https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/149733-14-13-122-environmentalvisualenhancements-140-1/&do=findComment&comment=3353432

It's not Kerbin, but it's an issue whatsoever.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/miult4rxhqjhby7/2018-04-13_2 KSP.log.7z?dl=1

If you look, "Unable to parse config node:" error is because the SVE OPMClouds.cfg is referencing a non existent texture. --> value = StockVisualEnhancements/Textures/GratianClouds

I downloaded all three low, med and high SVE texture packs and non contain that file. So it either misnamed or the file is missing.

How do I get this orange light between day and night?

 

 

Edited April 14, 2018 by PoomTGP

9 hours ago, Barar said:

If you look, "Unable to parse config node:" error is because the SVE OPMClouds.cfg is referencing a non existent texture. --> value = StockVisualEnhancements/Textures/GratianClouds

I downloaded all three low, med and high SVE texture packs and non contain that file. So it either misnamed or the file is missing.

Doesn't that file only apply for the Outer Planets Mod?

6 hours ago, PoomTGP said:

How do I get this orange light between day and night?

I believe sunrise/sunset/terminator cloud color changes are a Scatterer feature.

7 hours ago, PoomTGP said:

How do I get this orange light between day and night?

 

 

You use a different visual mod because SVE doesn’t/won’t have it. I have said it multiple times just recently in this thread, so think the effect is ugle and unrealistic. It pains me to have it on Eve and Jool.

 

9 hours ago, Barar said:

If you look, "Unable to parse config node:" error is because the SVE OPMClouds.cfg is referencing a non existent texture. --> value = StockVisualEnhancements/Textures/GratianClouds

I downloaded all three low, med and high SVE texture packs and non contain that file. So it either misnamed or the file is missing.

Yes, I’m aware, but I won’t have time to fix it this weekend.

Edited April 14, 2018 by Galileo

City lights no longer working with either BoulderCo or SVE. I just tried to reinstall all  EVE and SVE again. Low, medium or high texture setting generates no city textures, lit or not  

I’m on 1.4.2, Steam Mac. CKAN said there were updates, I think that’s when it broke.

I have clouds, but not as many as before.

Hello Galileo. Thanks for mantaining the awesome mods as always.

I think I'm getting too many clouds after I install SVE. Like nowhere close to what pictures in this thread look like. Is this normal? I'm back after a long break with KSP and I don't remember if this was the usual behavior.
